result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua James Wehrli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture or Deliver Prescription Drug, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(9)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Work out payment plan with agent.
Obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample on 3-15-16.  
Pay DNA surcharge.

Maintain absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.
Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  
Defendant is not to consume or possess any prescription medications without a valid prescription.
All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.

Court will hold expungement open.
Defendant shall successfully complete probation by paying all financial obligations and DOC supervision fees, serving jail time, following all other conditions as ordered.
Defendant shall write the Court upon the completion of these terms and the DA will verify that all conditions have been met.

AODA assessments followed by treatment and aftercare.
Complete any other programming including any counseling assessments and follow through treatment as deemed appropriate by the Dept. of Corrections.
Work out payment plan with agent.

timeConds.notes:
No credit.
No good time.
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

60 days jail, no credit, no good time, huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations, commencing 3-15-16 at 7pm

Fine $100 + costs + $45 service fees + $250 DNA surcharge + $56 buy money = $849.50 work out payment plan with agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.
Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  
Defendant is not to possess or consume any prescription medication without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.
